WYSIWYM.transformer
Class DependencyTreeTransformer

java.lang.Object
  WYSIWYM.transformer.GraphTransformer
      WYSIWYM.transformer.DependencyTreeTransformer
Direct Known Subclasses:
SpecificationTransformer
public class DependencyTreeTransformer
extends GraphTransformer

DependencyTreeTransformer.java performs all transformations on a DependencyTree.

Version:
1.0 2006/11/13, 1.4 2008/07/30
Author:
Feikje Hielkema

getGraph

public DependencyTree getGraph()

Overrides:
getGraph in class GraphTransformer

DependencyTree

append

public void append(DTNode node,
                   String type,
                   int nr)
Inserts a node into the tree in a conjunction, as a child of the specified type; used in the first aggregation stage (in ContentPlanner and TextPlanner)

Parameters:
node - Inserted node
type - Lexicon.SOURCE (source of property) or Lexicon.TARGET (target of property)
nr - Sequence number of conjunct (to preserve order of authors etc.)

insert

public void insert(DTNode node,
                   String type)
Inserts a new source or target node in the dependency tree in the place of the old one. This is the default method of insertion; for aggregation user append(DTNode, String, int)

Parameters:
node - DTNode to be inserted
type - Lexicon.SOURCE (source of property) or Lexicon.TARGET (target of property)

addBranchWithNewIDs

public void addBranchWithNewIDs(DTNode node)
Adds a branch from another Dependency tree to this one. For that, all id's must be changed (otherwise you may get components with identical id's). So all nodes and edges receive new id's, and the nodes are told about the edges' new ids.

Parameters:
node - Node to add

potentialPassive

public boolean potentialPassive()
Checks whether this tree can be set to passive, by checking whether it has a object (instead of a complement).

Returns:
true if this tree's verb can be set to passive.

setPassive

public void setPassive()
Sets the sentence to active or passive, depending on what it is now; if it is now passive, it will be active, and vice versa.

isPassive

public boolean isPassive()
Checks if the tree's verb is set to passive.

Returns:
true if the tree verb morphology says passive

setNegated

public void setNegated(boolean negated)
Negates or unnegates the sentence.

Parameters:
negated - True if the tree should be negated

setPlural

public void setPlural(boolean plural)
Sets the main verb to plural or singular

Parameters:
plural - True if the verb should be pluralised

getNodeWithRoot

public DTNode getNodeWithRoot(String root)
Retrieves a node with the given root word.

Parameters:
root - String root word
Returns:
DTNode

isInverseInserted

public boolean isInverseInserted()
Checks whether source and target of the tree were inserted the other way around (to accommodate an inverse property)

Returns:
true if source and target were inversely inserted

getInsertedNode

public DTNode getInsertedNode(DTNode dt)
Finds the DTNode with the same SemanticGraph ID as the given node

Parameters:
dt - old DTNode
Returns:
Equivalent DTNode

addRelativeClause

public int addRelativeClause(DependencyTreeTransformer clause)
If the topic of the relative clause is in this tree, and does not have other endmodifiers or the dep-role of determiner/modifier, the given relative clause is added.

Parameters:
clause - DependencyTreeTransformer with clause to add
Returns:
0 if there were no suitable nodes to add the clause to, 1 if the clause was added, 2 if there might have been a suitable node but it was replaced by a summation node.
